author: Joseph Aubourg
text: 'Great pizza'

author: Chanel ‚Äú„Ç∑„É£„Éç„É´‚Äù Right
text: 'This is so good! He went with ‚ÄòThe Brick‚Äô and I the ‚ÄòPenne Vodka‚Äô both were very delicious! The brick had a nice spice. While the penne was very flavorful! We enjoyed our evening here!'

author: Ultrasound Techniques
text: 'I‚Äôve ordered the blackened salmon wrap from here a few time which was always ON POINT! Tonight at 11pm I was happy to know they were still open because I needed a good meal aside from fast food. I ordered the ‚Äúfire salmon‚Äù instead which came with cauliflower
column5: \nCarrots
column6: asparagus
column7: and mashed potato. IT WAS AMAZING!! Better than some fine dining places I‚Äôve been to. I didn‚Äôt not expect such a perfect meal at that time of night. Compliments to the chef! That meal was well thought out; salmon cooked perfectly
column8: the sauce they cooked the veggies in was super flavorful and delicious
column9: and the veggies were still crispy and had texture. I would give more stars I would!'

text: 'Looking for good vegan Italian food? This is your place. A ton of gluten free options too.'

text: 'My family and I had a great meal. I would personally recommend the everything bagel pizza. Comfy environment and dog friendly. Everything we order was great.'

author: Brandon
text: 'Food is good for the price. I recommend this place if you‚Äôre looking for an Italian quick eats'

author: Justine E
text: "Pleasantly surprised with our visit to this restaurant. We love visiting new vegan spots and this was definitely worth it. The vegan mozzarella sticks were huge and so worth it. The garlic knots were delicious. The tomato sauce had a great flavor. The vegan Greek salad was very refreshing and had delicious dressing (can‚Äôt wait to try their other salads). We ended up ordering large half vegan buffalo chicken and half can‚Äôt believe it‚Äôs vegan pizza. To be honest the apps were where the excitement was. The pizza crust / flavors could have been a little more balanced
column5: but the apps make up for it!! There is an entire vegan menu and we can't wait to come back and try more entrees. The restaurant is located on a beautiful street great for date nights. Free parking on Sunday. They have a variety of gluten free options as well. Oh and the best part is they have a dog friendly patio out front!!"

author: Nicole Wenger
text: 'Great gluten free pizza options!'

author: Marcos de brito
text: 'We came back for more! Great choices Non Vegan and  Vegan food!! They are open until 4 am. I believe Fridays and Saturdays.  Please call and confirm it!'

author: Thomas Hayes
text: 'Large menu

text: 'I am lactose intolerant so vegan pizza is a rarity that is right up my alley. I was super excited to try the ‚ÄúThis Can‚Äôt Be Vegan?!‚Äù Pizza and it was yummy! From a non-vegetarian
column5:
the beyond meat ‚Äúsausage‚Äù was flavorful and satisfying.

My partner got the Sweet Mango Pizza and loved it. He ate most of it in one sitting!!

Unfortunately
column6: the crust on both was basically pita bread which is why our experience wasn‚Äôt 5 stars. I‚Äôd say the pizza is 3 stars but the garlic knots are 50 stars. They‚Äôre absolutely amazing!!\n\nGET THE GARLIC KNOTS NOW!'

text:
'First time order for this place
The pizza was thin and over cooked

And the total was $50 for tasteless burnt and poor quality food.'

text: 'Great gluten free pizza - crust was the right combination of crispy and doughy. Very tasty.'

text: 'Food was delicious and the staff was friendly.  I could definitely see myself as a repeated customer.'

text: 'Pizza was divine.'

text: 'If I had to put NO STARS I WOULD!\nI will never come here again! My food was under cooked
column5: unseasoned
column6: and missing the main ingredient! Once I told the waitress the manager only took $10 off of my bill and the dish which I did not eat because it tasted like a bowl of sugar! cost $17. This was my second try at this establishment and it will be my last!'

author: Graham
text: 'Ordered a chicken parm hero w/vodka sauce and received a hero with cold grilled chicken with some kind of lemon marinade and some sauce that did not taste like vodka sauce (or at least the lemon flavor of the chicken overpowered the sauce). Very disappointing and a waste of $16...'

author: Tracie Gonzalez
text: 'Vegan pizza was very good. :)'

author: Kaitlynn Rose
text: 'I would have loved to try the food on the menus as you guys have great reviews and vegan options! However
column5: your customer service skills need work. I spoke to two people who seemed nice but it was very obvious there were language barrier issues which is also fine and resolvable. After telling the first person my name three times
column6: I finally spelled it. Then after giving the address
column7: I was asked to hold (at this point I was a little skeptical and nervous and was thinking to call another pizzeria)  then a completely different person came on the line and was unable to enter my visa expiration date correctly? (His words not mine) Normally I would think it would be common sense to get a third person on the phone who can not only assist him with the card processing but also help me the customer who is looking to order and provide business. I kindly gave up and said ‚Äúnever mind
column8: I‚Äôll just order somewhere else üôÅ‚Äù and he just said ‚Äúok.‚Äù No further trying to assist me or get help from another person...disappointing. I support local businesses but not with that poor customer service. This review is simply constructive criticism and I\nhope in the future it will help you to be a better business.'

text: 'üëçüèª'

text: "Worst delivery experience I've ever had.\n\nGot the food 2.5 hours late

My delivery was on a day that it was sunny and no storms or flooding.  There happened to be storms on the day I posted

author: Chris Berkheimer
text: 'Avoid at all costs.  The Sicilian pizza is a burnt loaf of bread with cheese and sad toppings (which cost significantly extra).  Even the basil costs extra.  None of their pizzas look like their advertised photos
column5: and I would wager McDonalds‚Äô pictures look closer to the real thing than this place‚Äôs pizza.  The white pizza has no substance to it
column6: and it tastes more like grease than pizza.  I wouldn‚Äôt order this again if it was the last thing on the planet.  Spend your money elsewhere.  Literally anywhere else.'

author: Dan D
text: 'Why all this vegan nonsense?!  I used to love this place. Ordered from them almost every night of the week. But now they make pizzas without any cheese like nothing from an animal. I don‚Äôt know what they are thinking??? Nothing taste the same. They got infected by the vegan virus. Don‚Äôt go here anymore.'

author: RK Yoo
text: 'Ordered for delivery. Everything was delicious and fresh. Pizza was delicious and definitely abundant amount of fresh mozzarella and great sauce. The sandwiches and burger ordered were big and hearty. Burger had plenty of sauteed onions
column5: vodka sauce on grilled chicken has extra garlic on the bread. Yum! Would definitely order from them again.'

author: Maureen Saleeb
text: 'Amazing food and service! The go to Pizzaria / restaurant in Hoboken. Keto friendly :)'

author: Tomofthespirits
text: "Hi I'm Tom and i drive from Bayonne to Hoboken (25 minute drive) to get food from The Brick!  It is 100% worth it!  I'm vegan and have a gluten allergy and The Brick offers so many options.  They have a full vegan menu that includes salads
column5: pizzas
column6: sandwiches
column7:
dinners and apps.  Many gluten free options including pizza and the owner Mike makes most of the vegan cheese himself!  I found this to be very unique and enticing.

Over the summer I took my buddies to The Brick all the time and they loved it!   And they are meat eaters haha.  My buddy loved their chicken bacon ranch pizza.

The atmosphere and staff was very welcoming.  Me and my friends always have a great time!"

author: David Rosensaft
text: 'Great Vegan anf gluten - free options.  Food is fresh and delicious.'

author: smishra7
text: 'Originally
column5: my order was 1 hour late and the delivery person had a mix up where they left it downstairs for me and it appears that someone else took our food.\n\nFortunately the manager made it right
column6: personally called and delivered our order again after hearing about the incident. Excellent customer service. Thank you

author: Sterling Espaillat
text: "I was very excited to try this pizza joint
column5: i looked and looked but couldn't find vegan pizza anywhere for the life of me. Until i saw this heaven send location now with that being said it was a sad ending and i have never been soo disapponited in my life. Just to start off the pizza was cold and my sandwich was not spicy at all
column6: i shared a pie with three other people ( me vegan them not ) and we all had the same reaction. 22 dollars for one of the most tasteless  piece of thin bread in the history of thin pizza and lets not talk about their sandwich
column7: the chef himself told me all the stuff he added on it
column9: i was a little scared on how spicy it was going to be. Now put your finger in your mouth thats how spicy it was
column10:
it was also beyond greasy and the pepper were just burn that it didn't taste like anything but grease.

Am sorry to say it but if they thought that was decent pizza please close this place down or something.

** Worse 40 dollars i have ever spent**"

author: Eder Alvarado
text: 'After 20% tip on my delivery
column5: multiple discrepancies and misleading information on service rendered.'

text: 'This is Alex the MainEvent and this was my first time eating here

The serving was a good portion for me. And the food was excellent. Would come eat here again. Reccomend to all who are looking for great pasta\nAlso good customer service..'

text: 'Amazing Vegan Pizza and Caesar salad ‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è'

text: "The best pizza in Hoboken hands down! My girlfriend and I come here all the time. They have the most wide ranging vegan menu I've ever seen in a pizza place. We ordered the vegan Philly cheese steak pizza and it was out of this world good. I'm not even a vegan but I'll gladly eat vegan pizza from the brick any day of the week. Cannot stress how good the service is as well. Mike
column5: the owner I believe
column6: always is kind and courteous and ensures everything is perfect. If you're uptown in Hoboken there's really no other pizza spot you'd wanna go to. Also it's BYOB which is nice as well."

text: 'I wish I can give this place more than 5 stars. The ingredients are amazing and they make their pizza just perfect. I had their Philly steak pizza last night and I‚Äôm normally one to not eat the crust

They charge to deliver one street past 14th into weehawken when no other Hoboken restaurants do.  Pizza has no wood burning oven flavor what so ever.  I'm done with this place."
